pullRequest.title: Map various, mostly private parts of client.texture classes
pullRequest.bodyText:
This is mostly for documentation of the internal behavior of classes. There is one single mapping that I changed because it was a mistake (mipmap -> close in NativeImage), which becomes apparent when you compare the chained overload being called.
Some more context on names:

atlasWidth/Height: sprites need to know the final texture size of the atlas they're part of to calculate their position in [0,1] based coordinates.
maxLevel: I introduced this term in my TextureUtil PR and keep on using it; it always refers to the highest miplevel index that is wanted (so 0 -> 1 miplevels).
NativeImage#write: semantically the inverse operation to read
Sprite.Interpolation#apply was a bit tricky to describe because it appears like it overwrites one of the frames it's interpolating, but I have a hunch the space it is writing to is reserved for just this interpolated image data.
SpriteInterpolation#mix standard lerp, I chose the glsl naming (sans parameter names). bikeshed away =)
SpriteAtlasTexture#loadSprites: based off of profiler scope
many parameter names were given where a this.x = x correspondence with existing field existed in the constructor.

commit.message: Map various, mostly private parts of client.texture classes

nodes.bodyText: alpha? We use delta for this in lerp.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -60,3 +68,17 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_1058 net/minecraft/client/texture/Sprite
 		FIELD field_21758 images [Lnet/minecraft/class_1011;
 		METHOD <init> (Lnet/minecraft/class_1058;Lnet/minecraft/class_1058$class_4727;I)V
 			ARG 3 mipmap
+		METHOD method_24128 apply ()V
+			COMMENT Linearly interpolate between the current and next frame on all miplevels
+			COMMENT based on the tick position within the current frame,
+			COMMENT and upload the results to the currently bound texture to the frame slot at position (0,0).
+		METHOD method_24129 mix (DII)I
+			ARG 1 alpha

nodes.bodyText: Should be lerp to match MathHelper.lerp 😛

nodes.bodyText: So this is lerping by each r/g/b portion? maybe mention that to clarify from regular lerp, like add javadoc or call this lerpColor
